title: The Two Misanthropists
text:
The Two Misanthropists (Italian: I due misantropi) is a 1937 Italian <a href="historical%20film">historical</a> <a href="comedy%20film">comedy film</a> directed by <a href="Amleto%20Palermi">Amleto Palermi</a> and starring <a href="Camillo%20Pilotto">Camillo Pilotto</a>, <a href="Mar%C3%ADa%20Denis">María Denis</a> and <a href="Nino%20Besozzi">Nino Besozzi</a>.
It was shot at the <a href="Cines%20Studios">Cines Studios</a> and <a href="Cinecitt%C3%A0">Cinecittà</a> in <a href="Rome">Rome</a>. The film's sets were designed by the <a href="art%20director">art director</a> <a href="Giorgio%20Pinzauti">Giorgio Pinzauti</a>.
